result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda S McBride was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda S McBride

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda S Mcbride in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Amanda S Mcbride in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  2 days jail with 2 days credit.  Pay $50 fine + costs.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
2 days jail with 2 days credit - time served..  Pay $50 fine + costs + DNA surcharge.  Pay within 60 days or set up plan.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Amanda S Mcbride appeared by video. Attorney Anne Renc in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Resisting/Obstructing an Officer.
Court advises defendant of right to remain silent.
Defendant makes statemetns to the Court. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 1/26/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
